repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Maputo Corridor Revitalization
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. The key lessons
            specify the arduous process in developing genuine ownership,
            particularly in light of dramatic shifts in business
            practices, and political strategies. It reflects the complex
            privatization process, for, although divestiture of the
            Government's involvement in the management, and
            operation of the corridor facilities was the main objective,
            there was no clear indication of project ownership at the
            onset of the operation, since most government officials were
            reluctant about privatization of corridor facilities.
            However, the project proved to be an effective tool in the
            establishment of a continuous, and positive dialogue between
            the Bank, and the Borrower, conducive, finally to the
            government's full commitment. This dialogue became
            successful following the establishment of a High-Level
            Committee, with the appropriate decision-making power, which
            proved critical in accelerating, particularly, the complex
            concessioning process, and, further achieved the project
            objectives. In addition, it is suggested that, to initiate
            the concessioning, or privatization process of complex
            railway or port systems, the use of one, or two components
            should be enough, for its lessons allow effective
            improvements to the process further on.

18157527.theme: Pollution management and environmental health,Rural services and infrastructure,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization
18157527.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Maputo Corridor Revitalization
            (Technical Assistance) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project objective is to
            assist the government to restructure the Caminhos de Ferro
            de Mocambique (CFMs) in order to improve its long term
            efficiency.  The project includes the following components:
            (a) investment and financial advisory services which
            involves the detailed evaluation of the past performance,
            resources, and the scope for improvements in operating
            efficiency of the system; (b) legal advisory services which
            will assist the government to review, streamline and update
            the existing legal and regulatory frameworks with a view to
            facilitating the privatization of service provision on the
            system; (c) environmental analytical services which will
            involve the review of existing standards of occupational
            health and safety and pollution abatement, an examination of
            liability issues surrounding the environmental management of
            the system, the recommendation of environmental standards;
            (d) labor redeployment strategy which will involve the
            preparation of a detailed plan for the redeployment of
            surplus staff from all three corridor systems; and (e)
            handling equipment for the container terminal as well as
            communications equipment for operations control.
